sections.title: Introduction
sections.content: The Common Desktop Environment is a desktop environment for Unix and OpenVMS, based on the Motif widget toolkit. It was part of the UNIX98 Workstation Product Standard, and was long the "classic" Unix desktop associated with commercial Unix workstations. Despite being a legacy environment, it is still kept alive with support for Linux systems as well.

sections.title: Installation
sections.content: The base CDE system is installed through the cdesktopenvAUR package.

sections.title: dtlogin
sections.content: The cdesktopenvAUR package supplies dtlogin.service which upon starting will launch the CDE login manager.

sections.title: xinit
sections.content:
CDE can be directly launched with startx (install xorg-xinit):

```
$ export PATH=$PATH:/usr/dt/bin
$ export LANG=C
$ startx /usr/dt/bin/Xsession
```
